intro: Cabucala crassifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf cabucala, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable species for conservation efforts.
